meanings.definition: A robbery in which a person is held up at gunpoint and forced to hand over money or valuables.
meanings.sent1: During the stickup, the thief demanded all the money from the cashier.
meanings.sent2: The police arrived quickly at the scene of the stickup.
meanings.sent3: The stickup in the movie was intense, but the hero managed to outsmart the robber.
meanings.sent4: The stickup felt like a scene from a suspenseful thriller.
meanings.sent5: The news of the stickup spread rapidly throughout the small town.
meanings.sent6: After the stickup, the store implemented new security measures.
meanings.sent7: Witnesses described the stickup as a terrifying experience.
meanings.sent8: The stickup at the bank was foiled by a quick-thinking teller.
meanings.sent9: The stickup artist was eventually caught by the police.
meanings.sent10: The stickup caused a stir in the local community.

meanings.definition: A small adhesive piece of paper used for attaching things together.
meanings.sent1: I used a stickup to attach the note to the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The stickup on the wall kept falling off.
meanings.sent3: The stickup on the envelope sealed it shut securely.
meanings.sent4: The stickup held the poster in place perfectly.
meanings.sent5: She used a stickup to stick her drawing to the wall.
meanings.sent6: The stickup on the back of the card kept it closed.
meanings.sent7: He found a stickup to attach the loose papers together.
meanings.sent8: The stickup on the gift wrap added a nice touch.
meanings.sent9: The stickup on the label kept it from peeling off.
meanings.sent10: She used a stickup to stick the broken pieces back together.

meanings.definition: To remain in a particular position or state.
meanings.sent1: I had to stickup my hand to ask a question.
meanings.sent2: The poster wouldn't stickup no matter how hard I tried.
meanings.sent3: The idea seemed to stickup in his mind for days.
meanings.sent4: Her hair would always stickup in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The decision to stickup for her friend was easy for him.
meanings.sent6: The plan to stickup for the environment was well-received.
meanings.sent7: The memory of the event would stickup in his thoughts.
meanings.sent8: The need to stickup for justice was strong in her heart.
meanings.sent9: The importance of education would always stickup in their family.
meanings.sent10: His determination to stickup for what was right never wavered.
